comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Mrs. Longworth (Roosevelt's daughter) and Mrs. McCormick visited Teddy Roosevelt in Chicago's Mercy Hospital on 15 October 1912 after he was shot according to this New York Time article: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=990DE2DD133CE633A... NOT Jan 17, 1910. Careful comparison with enlarged version of the adjacent photo in the set, a wider shot the the Mercy Hospital entrance, suggest the two ladies are walking out of the same door here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2422669169/ See related: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2422669169/

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: lifeasdaddy: Thanks for straightening out the tangle. We'll correct the date and add a subject note.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
22056898@N07
comment._content:
Mrs. Joseph Medill McCormick, a.k.a. Ruth Hanna (1880 - 1944), Elected as a Republican to the 71st. U. S. Congress 
(4 Mar 1929 - 3 Mar 1931) from Illinois. 
Also, in 1930 she received the Republican nomination for United States Senate from Illinois, but lost.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Jane Addams was another hospital visitor: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405649452/in/p...

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: Ruth Hanna McCormick was the daughter of Marc Hanna of Ohio, the powerhouse of the Republican Party.
